body:
@paalbra are you able to reproduce this on a verison of powershell-core?  That line is correct - if the file exists, and the user hasn't said -Append (after some other conditions) - then delete the file before starting any of the real logic.   That wipes it out as expected.

And fwiw, works for me on:

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.7
OS                             Darwin 17.2.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.2.0: Sun Oct  1 00:46:50 PDT 2017; root:xnu-4570.20.62~10/RELEASE_X86_64
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

With beta.8, following the repro steps, it does delete the file if `-Append` is not used, as expected.  However, the transcript file does exist including a bunch of header information as well as the `stop-transcript` command.

@SteveL-MSFT I just ran through the repro steps and the issue is still present in beta.8 (with some changes).

Did you follow my steps all the way? What account did you use? The account I'm referring to as "myuser" should be an unprivileged account. The account doing the file access setup should be privileged (e.g. an administrator).

@charlieschmidt You should not be able to do that. I believe you might have missed some of the file ACL setup as well?

The ACLs should become the following after setup:
```
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.8> icacls C:\test
C:\test DESKTOP-IGCDSJ7\myuser:(OI)(CI)(RX)
        BUILTIN\Administrators:(OI)(CI)(F)

Successfully processed 1 files; Failed processing 0 files
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.8> icacls C:\test\my-transcript.txt
C:\test\my-transcript.txt DESKTOP-IGCDSJ7\myuser:(F)
                          DESKTOP-IGCDSJ7\myuser:(I)(RX)
                          BUILTIN\Administrators:(I)(F)

Successfully processed 1 files; Failed processing 0 files
```

When you start a transcript as "myuser" you now get the following in beta.8:
```
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.8> Start-Transcript -LiteralPath "c:\test\my-transcript.txt"
Start-Transcript : Transcription cannot be started due to the error: Access to the path 'C:\test\my-transcript.txt' is
denied.
At line:1 char:1
+ Start-Transcript -LiteralPath "c:\test\my-transcript.txt"
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [Start-Transcript], PSInvalidOperationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CannotStartTranscription,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.StartTranscriptCommand

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.8> Get-ChildItem -Force C:\test\
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.8>
```

There was no error before. So the silent part of my first reported issue is no longer the case.

While it properly emits an error now there is still an issue that should be addressed. Start-Transcript should not delete the file. It should rather wipe the content of the file.

Version
```
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.8> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta.8
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.8
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.15063
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

You could also reproduce this as an issue on Ubuntu. Since this is a different OS/filesystem the issue isn't completely the same. What happens on Ubuntu is that you won't be able to delete the file since this requires write permissions on the parent directory. This also wouldn't be an issue if Start-Transcript didn't try to delete the file.

```
myuser@ubuntu:~$ sudo mkdir /test
myuser@ubuntu:~$ sudo touch /test/my-transcript.txt
myuser@ubuntu:~$ sudo chmod a+w /test/my-transcript.txt
myuser@ubuntu:~$ ls -la /test
total 8
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root 4096 okt.  26 22:34 .
drwxr-xr-x 25 root root 4096 okt.  26 22:34 ..
-rw-rw-rw-  1 root root    0 okt.  26 22:34 my-transcript.txt
myuser@ubuntu:~$ pwsh
PowerShell 6.1.0
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /home/myuser> Start-Transcript -LiteralPath "/test/my-transcript.txt"
Start-Transcript : Transcription cannot be started due to the error: Access to the path '/test/my-transcript.txt' is denied.
At line:1 char:1
+ Start-Transcript -LiteralPath "/test/my-transcript.txt"
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [Start-Transcript], PSInvalidOperationException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : CannotStartTranscription,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.StartTranscriptCommand
 
PS /home/myuser> Stop-Transcript
Stop-Transcript : An error occurred stopping transcription: The host is not currently transcribing.
At line:1 char:1
+ Stop-Transcript
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [Stop-Transcript], PSInvalidOperationException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvalidOperation,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.StopTranscriptCommand
 
PS /home/myuser> Get-ChildItem /test/


    Directory: /test


Mode                LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                -------------         ------ ----
------         10/26/18  10:34 PM              0 my-transcript.txt


PS /home/myuser> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0
OS                             Linux 4.15.0-38-generic #41-Ubuntu SMP Wed Oct 10 10:59:38 UTC 2018
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
